column4: do you have a live cd or live usb, boot from that and do your backup
it doesn't seem to be load ing:/ but thanks I'll try to get a loadable live-cd
have you tried typing help and hitting enter
I have now, it gives me a set of commands
i run reboot and it seems to be running now :) thanks
are you sure you booting from the CD
have you tried booting to a cmdline , would probably bypass graphics issues
how can i do so?
try hitting f1-f6 while its booting
or you can hit any key when you get the little icon , https://help.ubuntu.com/community/BootOptions
f2 will show me the bios but that's it
skip f2, and let it get passed the bios screen before hitting keys
that logo shows up, and the menu also, that's the menu that doesn't do anything
ok
you look at that link i posted
and how do you mean it does nothing? is it lockedup
yep the logo and menu that show up are the ones in that site. When i mean nothing i mean it just boots back into this same menu
have you done the check cd for defects
a few years ago spent ages tring to workout why my rig was crashing, eventuly worked out the cpu was overheating
how can I get to the bottom of the problem?
think we might be getting a answer soon
try earth yourself first by touching a metal radiator or metal electric device that is pluged in first
